meanings.definition: Situated or occurring in front of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The preoral tentacles of the jellyfish help it sense its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the preoral structures of the fish to understand its feeding habits.
meanings.sent3: The preoral position of the bird feeder attracted many colorful birds to the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her preoral fashion sense was evident in the way she matched her accessories.
meanings.sent5: The preoral markings on the butterfly's wings were strikingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the area in front of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The preoral glands in the frog secrete enzymes to aid in digestion.
meanings.sent2: The dentist examined the preoral tissues for any signs of infection.
meanings.sent3: The preoral hygiene of the dog was impeccable, thanks to regular brushing.
meanings.sent4: His preoral speech emphasized the importance of oral health in overall well-being.
meanings.sent5: The preoral care of the baby involved gentle cleaning around the mouth area.
